messages.text: Bah humbug.
Hey, this Christmas trip was your idea!
Are you having second thoughts about it?
No, I’m excited.
Wow, sure sounds like it.
No! I promise I am, it’s just…
I guess it’s just sinking in that I won’t see my family for Christmas.
But you’ll get to see ME instead 😘
Who better to spend the holidays with than your bestie?
True 😘
I mean…if I even make it to New York tonight…
It’s snowing like crazy here in Chicago 🙁
They’ve canceled so many flights!
Wait, why are you in Chicago?
Layover.
I’m supposed to board in a few minutes…
But my plane isn’t even here yet.
I’m worried I’m going to end up spending Christmas at the airport.
I’m sure you’ll get here! 🤞
And you’re making the right decision—
Your family always bums you out when you visit them.
Especially at the holidays.
You’re right.
And mine’s out of town this year, so it’s perfect—
You and I are going to do Christmas in the city, single-lady style.
Whatever you say, Beyonce.
But Alexis feels a smile tug at her lips for the first time all day.
Come on, what’s not to love?
Martinis 🍸
Dancing 💃 🕺
Maybe we’ll even meet some hotties?
Lol, I’m not getting my hopes up.
But I am looking forward to spending time with you 🤗
AND that New Year’s Eve party at the end of the visit is gonna be epic.
THERE’S my best friend. I knew she was in there somewhere.
See? This trip is going to be great 🙂
But in the next moment, the PA system crackles and yet another flight is cancelled.
It’s 5:30 p.m. on Christmas Eve.
If Alexis’s plane doesn’t arrive soon…
She actually might get stuck at the airport for the holiday.
Speaking of hotties…
I’m sitting across from one right now.
I wonder if he’s on my flight?
Girl, I hope so.
Maybe he’s headed to New York for Christmas too!
The hottie in question looks up and catches Alexis staring.
He’s got the brightest green eyes she’s ever seen.
Overwhelmed by a sudden bout of nerves…
Alexis quickly buries her face behind her phone.
Maybe he’ll be my seatmate 🤞
That’s the spirit 🎄 🎅
Another voice comes over the PA system.
Alexis’s heart sinks when she sees that it’s the agent at her gate speaking.
Ladies and gentleman, National Air Flight #3289 with service to New York is now delayed.
A new departure time pops up on the board behind the gate agent.
A chorus of groans ripples through the seating area.
Alexis looks up.
She finds herself exchanging a sympathetic look with the hottie across from her.
Her stomach flips as his green eyes crash into hers.
So she ducks behind her phone again.
Delayed until 9:30 😞
Noooooo! 😢
Screw this. I’m going to go get a drink at the bar.
That sounds like an excellent idea.
And try not to worry.
You’ll get here sooner or later 🤷‍♀️
Text me again when you get bored or if there’s an update!
Will do.
She gathers her backpack and heads down the terminal.
There’s a cozy sports bar at the entrance, decorated with pine garlands and festive lights.
She smiles. This is just the place to get her into the Christmas spirit.
Though place is packed with stranded travelers…
Alexis finds that there’s one open barstool at the end of the bar.
She slides onto it, setting her backpack at her feet.
Martini on the rocks, please.
She thanks the bartender as he sets her drink in front of her.
Just as she raises the glass to her lips…
A deep, sexy voice caresses her eardrums.
That’s a fancy drink for an airport bar.
She turns to find the hottie from the gate standing right behind her!
And he’s wearing a wide, wicked grin.
Alexis feels herself melt a little.
Well, I’d promised myself a martini tonight.
And while I hoped to be drinking it in a fancy bar in Manhattan…
I wasn’t going to fall back on my promise.
The hottie laughs. The deep, rich sound is so soothing.
This isn’t how I planned to spend Christmas Eve either.
I was supposed to be in New York too, but Mother Nature had other plans.
He orders a beer and rests his elbows on the bar beside her.
I’m James, by the way.
Alexis.
Headed home for the holidays?
The opposite, actually. I’m abandoning my family.
Instead, my best friend and I are spending Christmas together.
I’m flying all the way across the country for this trip.
James raises an eyebrow.
And it makes him even more devastatingly handsome.
Adventurous.
I guess. But I’m not usually the adventurous type.
I’ve actually been feeling super guilty about it.
Looks like your Mother Nature is punishing me by leaving me stranded here in Chicago.
Not possible.
Why is that?
Because if anyone is being jinxed by the weather tonight, it’s me.
Taking a long sip from her martini, Alexis surveys her companion more closely.
What did you do to piss off Mother Nature?
I actually wished for this snowstorm.
I…didn’t really want to go home tonight.
Woah! You’re a bigger Scrooge than I am!
James shrugs a broad shoulder.
Looks like it.
Well, since you brought it up, you better dish.
Why don’t you want to go home?
For one, my empty apartment is kind of depressing.
I barely spend any time there, so it doesn’t really feel like home.
Where do you spend most of your time?
Here.
Here? At the airport?
Or in the sky.
You travel a lot, then?
Occupational hazard.
He gestures to the black rolling suitcase at his feet.
The airline’s insignia is stitched on the top.
Alexis takes another long pull from her martini to hide her intrigue.
You’re a pilot?
Yeah, but I’m off duty tonight.
Sorry for jinxing your trip to New York with my bad karma.
Alexis waves him off.
Mine’s just as bad. Between the two of us, our flight didn’t stand a chance.
Well, for what it’s worth, I’m pretty sure they’re going to get us to New York tonight.
You’ve got the inside scoop or something?
I do. According our systems, our plane is now in route to us.
And since the storm is letting up, we should be golden.
Alexis sighs.
Finally, some good news.
There’s a beat of comfortable silence, but Alexis rushes to fill it.
She doesn’t want her conversation with James to end.
So you live in New York, then?
Yup. It made sense for me.
I was born and raised in New Jersey, right over the bridge from Manhattan.
Where are you from?
Somewhere on the West Coast, since this is a cross country trip for you?
Yep. I live in Seattle.
My parents are in Washington, but over in Spokane.
Alexis and James spend the next two hours sharing drinks and conversation at the bar.
By the time their flight is ready, Alexis is giddy and a little tipsy.
She’s also somewhat smitten with her hottie pilot.
So…will you be home in New York for long?
Only for about twenty-four hours this time…
But I’ll be back again at the end of the week for a few days.
James looks at her meaningfully.
As she sinks into his soft green eyes…
Alexis can almost smell the rich pine scent of freshly cut Christmas trees.
She feels the holiday magic thrumming in the air…
And knows that this is her chance.
She needs to see him again.
Would you…like to grab a drink with me in the city?
He flashes her a warm smile.
It brings out the dimple in his right cheek.
I’d love that.
And you know, I fly into Seattle pretty regularly.
So maybe I could also take you out over there sometime.
You could show me all your favorite places.
The Christmas lights around them twinkle.
Alexis feels a similar sensation pulse through her body.
That sounds wonderful.
She tilts her head, smiling at the hottie pilot before her.
It’s weird. A couple hours ago, I was feeling like a total Scrooge.
But now…I think I’m finally getting into the holiday spirit.
Funny thing. So am I.
